titleStmt.title: Alfred Redl (born Lemberg, March 14, 1864; died May 25, 1913)

body.head: Alfred Redl (born Lemberg, March 14, 1864; died May 25, 1913)

div.p:
Alfred Redl (born Lemberg, March 14, 1864; died May 25, 1913), Austrian army officer who headed counter-intelligence for Austria-Hungary while at the same time being a Russian spy, selling crucial military secrets to Russia, and "shopping" his own agents. He was exposed on May 25, 1913 and committed suicide the same day.
Schenker reports and reflects on his exposure in the diary for May-June 1913 (OJ 1/12, pp. 358, 360-62).
